hive_event.author: anne002
hive_event.body:
![Portada de Youtube Thumbnail Vlog Collage Fotos Aesthetic Blanco_20250322_120151_0000.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/anne002/23uFgok99by8DBp25rBKq3RsYcX44E5WDb93eyp83bjSiGiCYmKjvGJ5RurTmZSBn9EP7.png)
![Picsart_24-10-09_13-54-38-867 (1).jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdvhfbVWxpzFddb7CnavZboi3zdEVK52Q3GHKseaTJJ8R/Picsart_24-10-09_13-54-38-867%20(1).jpg)
#
!Hola¡Si has llegado aquí a este tutorial ,es porque te da curiosidad cómo puedes confeccionar este modelo sencillo de delantal de cocina con solo poco materiales,a mi me gusta mucho la cocina sobre todo la repostería me encanta 🥰🍰asi que urgente necesitaba hacerme ya un delantal , lastimosamente la tela no me alcanzó para hacer el gorro de cocina 🥺pero bueno eso lo dejaremos para hacerlo en otro tutorial y vuelva a comprar nuevamente la tela para hacerlo.
# > ```Hello! If you have come here to this tutorial, it is because you are curious about how you can make this simple kitchen apron model with only a few materials. I really like cooking, especially baking, I love it 🥰🍰 so I urgently needed to make an apron, unfortunately the fabric was not enough to make the kitchen hat 🥺 but well, we will leave that to do it in another tutorial and I will buy the fabric again to do it.``` #
![Picsart_24-10-09_13-54-38-867 (1).jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdvhfbVWxpzFddb7CnavZboi3zdEVK52Q3GHKseaTJJ8R/Picsart_24-10-09_13-54-38-867%20(1).jpg)
Estaba buscando varios modelos de como hacer este delantal y quise irme por lo bonito por lo cuchi y tierno ,así que como encontré en la tienda de telas está linda tela en estampado de cuadros rojos que me está gustando mucho decidí comprarme la y ya hacerlo ,me gustó también porque la calidad d ela tela es muy buena es un poco gruesa y se ve muy resistente también siento que es como un poco impermeable que pues dura un poco para absorber la humedad y esto me gustó mucho porque estaré en contacto con la cinta y pues va a ser de muy buena ayuda que la tela en parte sea de este material.
# > ```I was looking for several models of how to make this apron and I wanted to go for the pretty, the cute and tender, so since I found this pretty red plaid print fabric in the fabric store that I really like, I decided to buy it and make it. I also liked it because the quality of the fabric is very good, it is a little thick and looks very resistant. I also feel that it is a little waterproof, which lasts a little while to absorb moisture, and I really liked this because I will be in contact with the tape and it will be very helpful that the fabric is partly made of this material.``` #
Para el modelo pensé hacer un estilo muy tierno y delicado como por ejemplo la forma de un corazón en el frente del talle delantero con un tirante ,y en la parte de la falda pues hice la falda corte semicircular o media campana para darle un estilo mas holgado al delantal con una cinta en la cintura que pues ya luego ajustare en mi cintura para mas comodidad,a mi me gustó mucho como quedó,espero te guste a ti también ♥️🧵.
# > ```For the model I thought of making a very tender and delicate style such as the shape of a heart on the front of the front waist with a strap, and in the part of the skirt I made the skirt semicircular or half bell cut to give a looser style to the apron with a ribbon at the waist that I will then adjust at my waist for more comfort, I really liked how it turned out, I hope you like it too ♥️🧵.``` # ---
![IMG_20250321_112639_492.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/anne002/Ep1VxvgGpWXkF4xjKBfF2neAgUkFzuaVRzh3QwHup5RHMiEejyFE1Q7r4UVnkxpUx9J.jpg)
![Picsart_24-10-09_13-54-38-867 (1).jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdvhfbVWxpzFddb7CnavZboi3zdEVK52Q3GHKseaTJJ8R/Picsart_24-10-09_13-54-38-867%20(1).jpg)
## _
Materiales:// Materials:
_ # * **_Usaremos 1 metro de tela vichy_** * **_3 metros de sesgo de 2 cm de ancho_** * **_Alfileres_** * **_Maquina de coser_** * **_Tijeras_** * **_Patrones correspondientes al diseño_** * **_Hilo_** # >* **_We will use 1 meter of gingham fabric_** >* **_3 meters of 2 cm wide bias binding_** >* **_Pins_** >* **_Sewing machine_** >* **_Scissors_** >* **_Patterns corresponding to the design_** >* **_Thread_**
![Picsart_24-10-09_13-54-38-867 (1).jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdvhfbVWxpzFddb7CnavZboi3zdEVK52Q3GHKseaTJJ8R/Picsart_24-10-09_13-54-38-867%20(1).jpg)
## _
Pasos a seguir://Steps to follow:
_ #
![IMG_20250321_111949_133.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmWaoc2wGSkWUdfGiuZb5ZgaxgqSXPiTQWfkn5UNys1Dn7/IMG_20250321_111949_133.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_112751_044.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmVxYdwr3gznFexaoAccR4BdbWFyrJekkVc6k5AMgWnv5m/IMG_20250321_112751_044.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_112717_942.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdEopZzgP5eVnuWoabs99TjiksZ69BCL9FbVVKPRkPnNg/IMG_20250321_112717_942.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_112820_711 (1).jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/anne002/23tvkSbeAUgbnqwRJdyposjF678E852dHZ166sT4xz4fXywTAU1MJRmFGfvKj4m3SaqUF.jpg)
### _Paso 01_
El primer paso es proceder a cortar las piezas, entonces empezaré colocando el patrón del talle delantero de 30 cm de largo para no dejarlo pues tan abajo de la cintura mi delantal,luego cortaré de esa pieza delantera cuatro piezas en este caso lo hacemos asi porque pues yo soy mas gordita y no me alcanzó la tela pero pues de esta solo sacaremos dos piezas con dobles, después cortamos la falda de 45 cm de largo y con solo la mitad del ancho de tu cintura más 6 cm para hacer los pequeños tablones adelante,cortamos por último una cinta de 1.50 cm de largo para la pretina de la cintura con 10 cm de ancho.
# > ### _Step 01_ > ```The first step is to proceed to cut the pieces, then I will start by placing the pattern of the front waist 30 cm long so as not to leave it so below the waist of my apron, then I will cut four pieces from that front piece in this case we do it like this because I am chubby and I did not have enough fabric but from this one we will only get two pieces with doubles, then we cut the skirt 45 cm long and with only half the width of your waist plus 6 cm to make the small pleats in front, finally we cut a 1.50 cm long ribbon for the waistband with 10 cm wide.``` ---
![IMG_20250321_113657_034.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/anne002/EoiXAqW1k4WjdEcYYsusuVpZStye46DMTY6RNKmv4xVfCbGsJ9q5TLmWW6rzaySf2uA.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_113816_021.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmQTt88MnSjiGT3HURRiAN5snp9JeriHEV2ud9T8kRXwBB/IMG_20250321_113816_021.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_114210_596.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmYjFyGNxacKW3rXVGhcNPeK9ocKvjEkQtavPxw5Ztyk5h/IMG_20250321_114210_596.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_114538_870.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmYeFtcCv9VyBRstDwsjfTYJEsmMdsahXYUhSqQihMQx11/IMG_20250321_114538_870.jpg)
### _Paso 02_
Con nuestra overlock o máquina sencilla que tenga zig zag para rematar el borde cosemos los bordes de la falda y con costura recta hacemos un dobladillo de cada lado de la falda luego en la parte de abajo de mi falda estaré cosiendo un sesgo por el contorno,para coserlo lo coso por la parte inferior (abajo) luego por la parte superior (arriba) lo repiso von costura normal,esto pata hacerle el detalle a la falda con el sesgo y quede muy bonito.
# > ### _Step 02_ > ```With our overlock or simple machine that has a zig zag to finish the edge we sew the edges of the skirt and with a straight seam we make a hem on each side of the skirt then at the bottom of my skirt I will be sewing a bias around the contour, to sew it I sew it on the bottom (below) then on the top (above) I reseal it with normal sewing, this to make the detail to the skirt with the bias and make it look very nice.``` ---
![IMG_20250321_114919_116.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/anne002/EogQBv7fpj1bYWWYP2BGHjfQHW5vmhatfXGiPViQGvWtp5kuuVWMTjHbM9uK9wZDfQ9.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_115408_925.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmYiepRaDS4oiiNq6YEByEvLpbMHEqdkP5z8Ks58qhbq3T/IMG_20250321_115408_925.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_120538_897.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmPKk2R39ETvmkKLH3cKqU9QBqmbBehGJvgeQZptM6LP2d/IMG_20250321_120538_897.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_120547_879.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmSi7yJP2BrjS2bYZEBAykNroDKtRqPyhKg5RKGwgdw1Sa/IMG_20250321_120547_879.jpg)
### _Paso 03_
Pasamos después a unir las piezas del talle delantero luego las uní con ambos alfileres de los lados para que no se nos ruede al coser, entonces dejamos a un lado la pieza y vamos a coser una tira con el mismo sesgo de 25 cm de largo para sostenernos el delantal,una vez lo coso lo que haremos será coser el sesgo por la parte de atrás y cuando lleguemos a la punta de ambas partes de los lado del corazon allí voy a colocar cada punta de la tira y seguimos cosiendo el sesgo por todo el contorno,luego volteamos precisamente hacia la parte frontal delantera y cosemos por encima repisando el sesgo.
# > ### _Step 03_ > ```We then join the pieces of the front waist then I joined them with both pins on the sides so that it does not roll when sewing, then we put the piece aside and we are going to sew a strip with the same bias 25 cm long to hold the apron, once I sew it what we will do is sew the bias on the back and when we get to the tip of both parts on the sides of the heart there I will place each tip of the strip and we continue sewing the bias around the entire contour, then we turn precisely towards the front front and sew over, overlaying the bias.``` ---
![IMG_20250321_121647_419.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmQNhbT2C2UsSxvCEEsbeF1RXA9pfVgquQ1oN1xTLNN3N2/IMG_20250321_121647_419.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_121952_203.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmQeH5w5k5qaLKPbx43wwPf48JjxT59UwQ71LPMCAEtBZD/IMG_20250321_121952_203.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_122138_220.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmS18nPDBukCgSvhaV9WUe38a49KVUPg2VrnykJWK6FZRK/IMG_20250321_122138_220.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_123000_534.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmUtoP3zEMCX7ojgFK3Qpyu9g9wkav5Vcf6josTi9SiuRd/IMG_20250321_123000_534.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_123004_193.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmS8w7gsTs5NdEgaMjR4UA4HNpnUZgR9RPnWfSUfNDEFbH/IMG_20250321_123004_193.jpg)
### _Paso 04_
Hasta este punto vamos a unir la falda a nuestra cinta de la cintura haciendo los dos tablones en la falda de 3 cm de ancho cada uno luego cosemos los extremos de loss tirantes de la misma cinta de ambos lados, después cosemos la pieza de adelante del corazón a la tira reforzamos con costura recta una vez cosimos en overlock y pues puedes pasar a planchar la pieza para un mejor acabado.
# > ### _Step 04_ > ```Up to this point we are going to join the skirt to our waist ribbon by making the two pleats in the skirt of 3 cm wide each one, then we sew the ends of the straps of the same ribbon on both sides, then we sew the front piece of the heart to the strip, we reinforce it with a straight stitch. Once we sew in overlock, you can then iron the piece for a better finish.``` ---
![Picsart_24-10-09_13-54-38-867 (1).jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdvhfbVWxpzFddb7CnavZboi3zdEVK52Q3GHKseaTJJ8R/Picsart_24-10-09_13-54-38-867%20(1).jpg)
## _
Resultado:// Result:
_ #
Una vez finalizo de hacer algunos detalles de mi delantal me lo probé y así es como queda muy bonito y tierno listo para ser usado en la cocina y hacer oficios ,así pues ya no tendré la molestia de ensuciar mi ropa cuando voy a hacer cualquier comida en la cocina que tenga que ver con harina, Siempre terminamos manchados de harina nuestra ropa y nuestras manos asi que estar es una buena opción para colocarlo encima de tu ropa y bueno no se te manche nada,lo bueno es que puedes lavarlo cuando quieras.
# > ```Once I finished making some details of my apron I tried it on and this is how it looks very pretty and tender ready to be used in the kitchen and do chores, so I will no longer have the trouble of dirtying my clothes when I go to make any food in the kitchen that has to do with flour, We always end up stained with flour on our clothes and our hands so this is a good option to place it over your clothes and well you do not stain anything, the good thing is that you can wash it whenever you want.```
![IMG_20250321_162605_943.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmX9MhHmMRgsJWsyUNbi7RbwjpfSfY9SE1rip1Qh6vhJ25/IMG_20250321_162605_943.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_162544_789.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmcb51qwYq9dRGSoxLRTWFmyMLde2vGzFLvbKUriZZo7xf/IMG_20250321_162544_789.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_162521_809.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/anne002/23u6J4VUb5P9NSaQsh4bRPeeSadLetMKbx4s9GktkkjMuo63ZZRAwTxisHanaTyiXMbcG.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_162501_549.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/anne002/23u6JDoWxky3Wt9CuhbLroReC692yX6CQqtTT22o9FXCVTocKtaQ5GjyUvnMkTmnj8AEg.jpg)
![IMG_20250321_162435_845.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmac9vizS2DWMdAfwfMTXQiMnmC1LW5Kxu6qAxxX5saNjK/IMG_20250321_162435_845.jpg)
Por cierto si te ha gustado esta idea no olvides compartirla con otros ,espero te guste mucho el resultado y gracias por sacar un poco de tu tiempo para leerme ,nos vemos en otro próximo tutorial.✨🧵🪡🥰
# > ```By the way, if you liked this idea, don't forget to share it with others. I hope you like the result a lot and thanks for taking some of your time to read me. See you in another upcoming tutorial.✨🧵🪡🥰``` #
![Picsart_24-10-09_13-54-38-867 (1).jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdvhfbVWxpzFddb7CnavZboi3zdEVK52Q3GHKseaTJJ8R/Picsart_24-10-09_13-54-38-867%20(1).jpg)
# **_
Creando las cosas con amor 🌷❤️
_** **_
🦋✨Todas las imágenes de esta publicación son de mi autoria ,📱tomadas con mi celular TecnoSpark8C |📸Fotos editadas en PicsArt y Canva. Texto traducido en el traductor de Google.
_** # > **_
Creating things with love 🌷❤️
_** > **_
🦋✨ All the images in this publication are my author ,📱taken with my TecnoSpark8C cell phone |📸Photos edited in PicsArt and Canva. Text translated in Google Translate.
_** ---
![Video de Youtube Outro Final Agradecimiento Bonita Acuarela Rosa_20250310_082357_0000.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/anne002/23xVeaEkMhPqf4AkJWYWp9orUaATUaooS4ZFDGeXLz1JC696Gz7KW5FmcBShV87FCqK56.png)

hive_event.author: alstonsjournal
hive_event.body:
Hello there! Every year, we celebrate our birthdays in another city (preferably one we haven’t visited before). We celebrated my girlfriend’s birthday last Friday and decided to go on a short trip for the weekend. Mysore, India is a city in the southern part of India and was on @foodiechique ‘s radar for quite some time. I began working on my itinerary a week in advance, which was then awarded the ‘Best Itinerary till Date’ by my girlfriend. 😂 Once we stepped foot in the city, we wasted no time and headed to the first stop which is the Mysore Palace. I’ve already posted this bit [here](https://peakd.com/hive-178708/@alstonsjournal/experiencing-echoes-of-royalty-at-the-mysore-palace), do have a check! Once we were done with the palace, we visited a beautiful cathedral built in a Neo Gothic style of architecture.
St. Philomena's Cathedral
![IMG-20250322-WA0018.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23xAP6LkmcSu64Uf9BB64UnEHwyTjhWHv9fxSZQ758X8s9KpLQEfwX9Mntx83wSTwjUKM.jpg)
Built in 1936, this cathedral design was heavily influenced by the Cologne Cathedral in Germany. The church was initially built as a small wooden chapel in 1843 to serve the British officers stationed at Mysore and later in 1936, the foundations were laid by the Wadiyar ruler with the help of the British East India Company. The church was designed by a Frenchman named Daly and the floor plan of the church resembles a cross! Since the skies were in our favor, I got pictures of the church along with my birthday girl.
![IMG-20250322-WA0022.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23vsG6KFXfBUR8WnJr5gFa48Bz973QaXiusgquaxT1HgEbmEfD19vZqZcQMPRuGmmv8qM.jpg)
![IMG-20250322-WA0016.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23tvXvekB3HU7P9B4s2Gy1w8XemuaYJvMPfKALD3srj1xjHJcPn9dUG5u9qd3vbZaiBGU.jpg)
![IMG-20250322-WA0017.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23wqa7oSv84rogr65idTCsBmah9Bwyt9BUumq8gJAhQiJou81zLrgJDkV1mmYcnxqvtSh.jpg)
![IMG-20250322-WA0025.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23xAR8VUypHANa2WghXGHs1M27M2YRmALJjL1Xt7H3FKRJWbiFwarWWjfS9acqkfHix4G.jpg)
Once we appreciated the intricate details of the church on the outside, we decided to head inside for some prayerful silence. However, you do need to take of your footwear before entering the Cathedral.
![IMG-20250322-WA0019.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23tGcHxsn4ofWmdkQCdsbHQk764kuQU2LurZSF2qfhXs87BEBYwMgqeYcuzfGNbgPDXQk.jpg) ![IMG-20250322-WA0020.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23x171jed9qnarwxYESqJ5vhYVtZc3FwiifNQHVz8txuRQnPAsP1kHRsvWpUVczHwT9cc.jpg)
Inside the church was simple yet elegant. The tall ceilings, stained glasses and the beautiful arches made it come alive. Even though the temperature outside was almost 35 degrees Celsius, it was cool inside the church due to the high ceilings and the stones used to build the church that kept the heat away. The church had a catacomb built underneath the altar to replicate the final resting place of St. Philomena.(I refrained myself from clicking any further images since it was a sacred place of worship). As we made an exit from the church, our stomachs began to growl, and we headed to a café to get a late lunch. We had heard wonderful things about it and wished to visit since a year now. ---
SAPA Sourdough & Pastry
![IMG-20250322-WA0037.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/AJhUTYCkenRp5nmuHdxcdus9DotLdjB337LExdH8BFoe4Bmp2g5tHLnEsyDupyx.jpg)
Located in the heart of Mysore city, this beautiful café is run by a German woman-Dina Weber, who came to India after mastering the art of sourdough. She moved to Mysore after working in multiple parts of India such as Goa and Manali. Now settled in Mysore, she opened this café in 2020 as a micro bakery serving only sourdough and breads and then expanded over the period to make it a beautiful restaurant that is based in a heritage home. The restaurant has been featured in ‘India’s top 50 restaurants’ in 2024. Once we tasted the food and desserts, we knew why!
![IMG-20250322-WA0021.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23wX3hBkEUoarfNKcQ3gNADfx9y8Nt8aEtLzgjtGsacgbk7FzxbhHc8fGkFNMLiMM8HZV.jpg)
![IMG-20250322-WA0036.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23vsGJJhrWbXHYkNSCRdm2zAGw7SgyEWuC41A3pVpGZ8zwz7RQU9BoPn6AsygfZLC4j6Y.jpg)
One look at the place will tell you that Dina has an eye for design because she has done up the place by integrating structural elements of the architecture into her choice of décor. Between the arched windows and mirrors and the vibrant white nestled in a lush green space, this place truly stands out. The restaurant has an outdoor and an indoor seating. We got here in the late afternoon and knew we would be here for a while, and it would get dark by then. So, we opted to sit inside.
![IMG-20250322-WA0024.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/AK57BLK7JRzu4AEGz9qUB4tnf8LxmKcwgkRY2dcnPppBL78tT1LjoiuUU6xhsma.jpg)
We ordered the Goat Cheese Chilli Bhajji as an appetizer. Bhajji basically is a fritter and the filling can vary. In this case, it was a chilli stuffed with seasoned cheese, coated with gram flour and deep fried to achieve that crisp texture. The first bite was heavenly! The melted gooey cheese was complimented the spice from the chillies. Served with some Sweet Chilli Sauce, everything together was a symphony of flavors!
![IMG-20250322-WA0027.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/AJpm876gishnKkqsTT8eA5bTcxzhwHYTkvHCqmNDUYDxw4WR3UWsL5sKVkkssX3.jpg)
We next ordered our main courses, and one was already waiting for us (thanks to their fast service). The Pulled Pork sandwich was a thing of beauty, and oh man, the portion sizes are huge. The slow-cooked pulled pork was so tender, it was melt-in-your-mouth. It was served in a ciabatta bread (freshly baked in-house) and served with hand cut fries with some spicy garlic aioli sauce. While the pork could use a bit more seasoning, overall, still delicious!
![IMG-20250322-WA0029c.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/AKF9nEdM9ewQ7oFY1Gkbt32S6E4oDHkFQzqcUZhLXmQEKnU7BY2qXksKsV4WK65.jpg)
The next main was not on our list of things to try but we gave it a shot since it was a fusion dish. We ordered Chorizo and Prawn Stew, merely as an experiment, since seafood with meat are not a very popular combination around here. To our surprise, this dish was the start of the show! Since the stew was brought to the table, it smelled divine. It came with a side of brioche loaves to soak up all the spicy goodness. The creaminess of the stew came from being slow cooked in coconut milk, the chunks of chorizo gave it a wonderful tang and the toasted sesame seeds on top gave the mouthful a very welcome crunch. We got so full that we had to stop and pack this up, which we later gobbled as a midnight snack. We assumed that the cold dish would not taste as good but again to our surprise, it tasted even better!!
![IMG-20250322-WA0032.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23tmN1eqf59RwuRC8spa7xwNQ2VovykW4YjFPa6Pn6x3k2D24ZKqFPN3Xbv2wtuN9pDcW.jpg)
![IMG-20250322-WA0033.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23vsUgdaRCPUXMJpMNBEpb4xbCd7HizJzcp43FJuQVbK5nwmkcfwcWFXsw5CJzRxdHT9V.jpg)
While our stomach was full, there is always some space for desserts. We went to the counter to check out the desserts display. We had limited options to choose from, and we picked the Mocha Bombolone and a Strawberry Mousse cake on the recommendation of one of the servers.
![IMG-20250322-WA0031c.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23wCGAT9rL9WzLcCZ26K2WTXQcpmbbiCz6KrWhA5mG1NgHWSxioUWWSuMmFA3SjRBqa7L.jpg)
The Mocha Bombolone was a classic, generously filled with mocha cream and then coated with castor sugar. Although this was yum, it did get a bit too sweet after a couple of bites.
![IMG-20250322-WA0034.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23w2sW7xPL5fGyEprhYhWT5miPrMGHo8gH4NtcYxjXu6F23qFtEkFEGXLcncLMioW8CDv.jpg)
And then came another star - the Strawberry Mousse Cake. I do not think I have had anything like this. Berry desserts are usually risky to order because they tend to taste syrupy (not sure if I’m the only one haha). But this? This was textural heaven. So many different textures in each layer of the cake but re-enforcing the flavor of strawberry. This ones for the history books, folks. It’s that good. With our stomachs and hearts full, we then planned to ride to the Chamundi Hills for a night view of the beautiful heritage city. ---
![IMG-20250322-WA0038.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23swZn4aBQp7FrLxyBiBhqbc1kNu7k7r7BZ73S8iBcaxLCPwAgZ9fJAztuDMPDgtvc3Cw.jpg)
Chamundi Hill
Located 13 km (8 miles) east of Mysore city, the name of the hill comes from the historic 12th century temple based on the top of the hill, Chamundeshwari temple. We had no plans to enter the temple, but I knew the view from the top of the hill during the night would be beautiful, hence the itinerary was designed to reach the top once the sun was set. The winding roads and the cool breeze made for a very pleasant ride, although it was not as well-lit and could feel spooky occasionally. We stopped at a place that had a small viewing deck with a few vendors that had set up stalls for light snacks (corn on the cob, juices, etc).
![IMG-20250322-WA0035.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23t72p72ncWgF6BxXUD4dta3LYUhaWESAVDWzxdtU9fkZwxgJFE2PKqPnD1KFhCevPQRP.jpg)
The skies were clear so we could see the city lights till the end of the horizon. There wasn’t much of a crowd at the viewpoint, probably because we did not go all the way to the top but went to the deck half a kilometer below. There was continuous mild lightening which was spectacular to watch. The pictures truly do no justice to the feeling of being there. Immense serenity and a great way to wind down a birthday, in my opinion.
![VID-20250322-WA0009-ezgif.com-optimize.gif](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23sweHQjEZWQjgwv4xKaLjXWaBdmbLHi6VzfUMGZLsQUDtwNfZuVjx1pPwBPAmyPfu8Nx.gif)
After spending some time up there taking in all the fresh air and the beauty of the night sky, we called it a day and went back to our hotel for some well-deserved rest. Although birthday girl chose to watch TV till midnight in her pajamas, she seemed truly content and that made my day.
Follow me to read more like this!
![PeakD divider.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/alstonsjournal/23tmobsa36U9gmD6YnJYPwzezbg2EriBZRTfniasHD8aDYYY9CZaWYc9qCt7D4E7eqkY4.jpg)
Do Upvote, Comment, Repost And Follow If You Like My Content. Until My Next Post, Cheers!
[//]:# (!worldmappin 12.295761 lat 76.641286 long d3scr)
hive_event.title: Exploring Mysore - The Heritage City

hive_event.author: nftea.gallery
hive_event.body:
[![ko0dk603z3xsb29awxb356qmpol2.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmbpuccCWxHWkbQuTZJkTB4GXpDDAKehoNTnWMUkyxCeJF/ko0dk603z3xsb29awxb356qmpol2.png)](https://nfteagallery.gumroad.com/l/mastering_art_of_ai_podcast_production)

## Check out my [latest e-publication](https://nfteagallery.gumroad.com/l/mastering_art_of_ai_podcast_production)! A great strategy guide!

This ebook details the utilization of NotebookLM, an artificial intelligence application, for the generation of AI-driven podcasts. NotebookLM analyzes uploaded documentation to produce summaries, detailed explanations, and conversational audio overviews, with a focus on leveraging the Audio Overview feature for podcast-style audio content suitable for YouTube distribution. The author shares their direct experience using NotebookLM to develop YouTube podcast episodes across various subjects, reporting initial positive results in subscriber growth and audience interaction.

A structured workflow for AI podcast production is presented, designed to facilitate the creation of high-quality content even under time constraints. This ebook outlines methodologies for identifying trending topics, sourcing reliable information, and employing AI tools to enhance efficiency and optimize content. A comprehensive approach to podcast creation is offered, encompassing brainstorming, competitor analysis, source validation, and prompt engineering.

This resource provides the requisite knowledge and skills for navigating AI-driven podcasting, whether for personal enrichment or entrepreneurial endeavors in AI content production. Guidance is given on utilizing AI for creative output, producing engaging podcasts, and establishing a prominent presence in the podcasting sphere.

Exclusive insights and advanced techniques for maximizing NotebookLM functionality are disclosed. These include procedures for exporting text sources to markdown, circumventing audio customization restrictions, and strategies for optimizing YouTube engagement. Information on participating in the official NotebookLM community forums on Reddit and Discord, where Google provides support, is included. The necessity of a Google One subscription for dedicated podcasters is discussed, alongside information on AI content watermarking and alternative open-source solutions.

---

Check it out on GumRoad! https://nfteagallery.gumroad.com/l/mastering_art_of_ai_podcast_production

Thanks to everyone who decides to purchase this ebook, I hope you get everything you're looking for from it! :)

Cheers

hive_event.author: babygirl888
hive_event.body:
https://img.leopedia.io/DQmXwcn8tgskvg1WA8UKJLNh3DcVWZG5iTHYdtTum8TwmbE/IMG_1765.jpeg [source](https://pixabay.com/illustrations/music-sound-speakers-loud-speaker-5268290/)


I heared it deep down in my spirit. It was a still small voice yet it was visible enough to be heard. Don’t go this night, it said, leave it till tomorrow morning.

Why will I leave that till tomorrow? I queried with my mind. I have already made up my mind to go today and that’s what I will do. Even though it’s getting late but it’s just an hour drive from here. I would quickly rush down to the park, get into a bus and in the next one hour, I would be there. I mused. 

I was talking to myself. There was silence but I knew I heard that still small voice. 

Well, I told the people I was with. Am off to the next town to catch up an early morning meeting. I would ring you up later. Take care of yourselves and you too they said as they bid me farewell.

I took a bike and my bag and was headed to the park where I boarded a bus to the next town. It was a peaceful ride to the next town. What harm would there be?

I just wanted to be in town early for my meeting the next morning. The junction was dry as it was almost 8pm. People were retiring for the day. I saw a taxi loading and it was just one chance to be filled. I quickly hopped in and the journey to the next stop started.

Meanwhile, I noticed the car door was opening and closing and I complained to the driver about it but he didn’t talk. On the third opening, I tried to jam it by force and the next passenger beside me began to scream that I jammed his hand to the door. I had an attack of the wobbles and my heart raced.

I tried frantically to open the door to no avail while the passenger continued to scream. The car was still moving but everyone seemed to be cool with the drama except me who actually thought I had jammed the door on his hand.

The other passengers adviced I drop my phone on the taxis dashboard and try to open the door with my two hands. Without thinking, I quickly obeyed and magically the door opened as I pushed harder. 

Come down come down, the man screamed in pain as the taxi came to a halt.I grabbed my bag and jumped down. I thought the man wanted to come down too. The taxi zoomed off with my phone still on the dashboard. It was then it occurred to me I had been robbed.

I was left stranded in the middle of no where. If only I had obeyed the still small voice that said don’t go this night, go tomorrow morning. I would have been saved from all the troubles I passed through that night. 

Posted Using [INLEO](https://inleo.io/@babygirl888/hearing-the-voice-of-god-2-9ds)
hive_event.title: Hearing the voice of God #2

hive_event.author: cinemaart
hive_event.body:
### **Кремлевская дезинформация: эволюция тактики и дипломатические последствия**  

Связанная с Кремлем сеть дезинформации «Матрешка» активизировала публикацию фейковых видео от имени американских спецслужб накануне президентских выборов в США. Анализ проекта «Блокировщик ботов» показывает, что в первые дни ноября объем подобных публикаций резко увеличился, а в день голосования 5 ноября тролли сконцентрировались исключительно на этом виде контента.  

**Тактическая эволюция кремлеботов**  
Ранее российские дезинформационные кампании были нацелены в основном на распространение недостоверной информации через соцсети и фейковые медиа. Однако нынешняя стратегия демонстрирует новый уровень изощренности: боты сознательно создают фейки, которые затем разоблачаются ФБР и американскими спецслужбами. Это приводит к парадоксальному эффекту: чем больше официальных опровержений, тем шире распространяются фейки, так как упоминания о них попадают в медиаполе западных стран.  

Подобная тактика была опробована в 2016 году, когда российские аккаунты в соцсетях распространяли ложные сведения о расследовании ФБР в отношении Хиллари Клинтон. Тогда агентство официально опровергло некоторые фейки, но это лишь усилило их распространение – дезинформаторы начали использовать сам факт опровержения как «доказательство» скрываемой правды.  

**Анализ и дипломатический контекст**  
В текущей геополитической ситуации использование дезинформации как инструмента внешней политики остается одной из ключевых стратегий Кремля. После вторжения России в Украину и последующих санкций западные страны ужесточили контроль за российскими информационными операциями, однако это привело не к снижению их активности, а к изменению методов работы.  

На фоне ухудшения отношений между Москвой и Вашингтоном Кремль продолжает использовать дезинформационные кампании для подрыва доверия к западным институтам. Особое внимание уделяется США, где предвыборный процесс традиционно становится объектом атак – от попыток манипулирования общественным мнением до распространения теорий заговора.  

**Прогноз: что дальше?**  
- **Рост качества фейков**. С развитием технологий ИИ и дипфейков можно ожидать появления все более сложных видео- и аудиофальсификаций, что затруднит их опровержение.  
- **Попытки дискредитации выборов в США и ЕС**. В 2024–2025 годах возможны новые волны дезинформации, направленные на подрыв доверия к избирательной системе США и предстоящим выборам в Европарламент.  
- **Международные меры противодействия**. Вероятно, западные страны усилят координацию в борьбе с информационными угрозами, включая новые законодательные инициативы и санкции против организаторов дезинформации.  

Таким образом, текущая кампания по фейковым видео – лишь часть долгосрочной стратегии Кремля, нацеленной на дестабилизацию западных демократий и продвижение альтернативных нарративов. Вопрос в том, насколько эффективно страны Запада смогут адаптироваться к новым реалиям информационной войны.

CASBT в Elk: "**Кремлевская дезинформация: эволюция тактики ..." | Elk
https://elk.zone/qoto.org/@casbt/114207355555619779
